[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Print Management System (PMS) defines requirements for document transmission and printing in a LAN environment with ASCII and PostScript printers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS enables efficient document routing, format validation, and print job queuing, ensuring compatibility with various printer types.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with network devices, document sources, and printer management systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides an interface for document submission, print queue tracking, and job management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports ASCII and PostScript printers within a LAN.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS utilizes TCP/IP for document transmission and printer communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS transmits print jobs securely over the LAN.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS is optimized for large print queues and efficient packet processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS manages document routing, job prioritization, and printing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS is configurable for different LAN topologies and printer setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS connects with print queue management, network monitoring, and logging services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS facilitates document transmission, format-based routing, and print queue management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS is designed for network administrators and users submitting documents for printing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ASCII printers support only ASCII; PostScript printers support both formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS relies on stable network connectivity and printer compatibility.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Document Routing: Directing documents to the appropriate printer.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall receive print jobs as packets from networked sources (REQ-DB-15).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall route documents to the appropriate printer based on format and availability (REQ-PERF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process ASCII and PostScript documents, ensuring proper format validation (REQ-DB-39, REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall validate document format before assigning it to a printer (REQ-DB-94).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage print queues based on printer availability and job priority (REQ-PERF-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a dashboard for monitoring print queues.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process and transmit print jobs within 5 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store print job details, including sender, format, and priority.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall log printer activity, errors, and job execution.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store user activity logs and job history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce format-based routing, efficient packet transmission, and queue management.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with TCP/IP networking and printer communication protocols.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log print job submissions, printer assignments, and transmissions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests document routing, printer compatibility, and transmission efficiency.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API docs, and printer compatibility documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: Networking standards, printer communication protocols, and LAN administration guidelines.
